reviews.text: I have seen many beautiful churches, cathedrals and monasteries all around the world, but gosh, this one beats them all! It was so stunning and awesome, literally took my breath away. I guess I will just let my photos do the talking because now words can describe the beauty I saw in this place!!

Amazing cathedral with a rich interior what is full of frescoes, tapestry, beautiful old icons, modelings and carved wooden furniture. It is the most beautiful church where u have ever been! Also you can listen a history of that place
There’s a lot to see in this part of Bergamo! The old town is one of a kind. Love it!
Very nice place, visit it;) entrance is Free and you must absolutely see it inside!
Serine and peaceful...go to Bergamo, it’s worth the trip. Beautiful old city.
Very interesting place to visit, the whole Bergamo Alta deserves a deep diving in its historical monuments
Open only on Mondays now and you have book it to be able to visit.
Great view, must see if you visit Bergamo. Would book in advance in summer. Guide is really nice although his English is definitely not perfect, but he is trying! :)
Magical night place with a magnificent view of the city

Башня Гомбито была построена в 12 веке. Высота - 52 метра. Если сможете преодолеть 263 ступеньки и подниметесь наверх, откроются потрясающие виды. 
В башне расположен туристический офис.
Una piccola chiesa, semplice, discretamente tenuta, con quadri ed arredi storici. Ad unica navata, certo non regge il confronto con altre chiese di Bergamo, ma val bene una visita ed una preghiera.

Fuori abbastanza anonima ma dentro mostra un impianto architettonico interessante e opere pregevoli tra cui  un Palma il giovane, un Moretto, un Previtali,delle tele del Cavagna eccellenti esempi di pittura lombarda.

Non lasciatevi ingannare dalla facciata semplice e priva di decorazioni, entrate!!! Scoprirete un interno armonioso con pianta a tre navate, cupola e abside di impronta neoclassica arricchito da innumerevoli opere d’arte, fra le principali «L’ultima cena» e «Cristo e l’adultera» di Antonio Cifrondi (ai lati dell’altare), «Adorazione dei Pastori» di Gian Paolo Cavagna, «Madonna con il Bambino e i Santi Eusebia, Domneone e Domno» di Alessandro Bonvicino detto il Moretto, «Compianto sul Cristo morto, con i Santi Pietro e Andrea» di Andrea Previtali (parete destra), «Adorazione dei pastori» Jacopo Negretti detto Palma il Giovane, «Natività » di Enea Salmeggia, Gian Giacomo Barbelli e de Padovanino (parete sinistra). Non perdetevi poi la sagrestia con i suoi preziosi arredi e la parte sotto la chiesa, dove a breve verrà riportato in funzione il teatro.

Fasada bardzo strona — wręcz zniechęcająca. We wnętrzu ciekawa ambona i baptysterium. Ołtarz to obraz klasycyzmu. Czy warto tam zajrzeć — tak, ale polecam przed wizytą w katedrze (odwrotna kolejność grozi brakiem zachwytu)
Ricca di storia e arte
The view is worthy!
Palácio muito bonito do 'século XVIII, porém não é aberto a visitação. Hoje é uma propriedade privada com moradores. Uma pena não ser um ponto turístico aberto a visitação.
Non so. Non sono mai entrata
Bel palazzo nobiliare a ridosso della porta S.Giacomo con bassorilievi a figure classiche

Увидели этот неоклассический дворец по соседству с базиликой Манта Мария Маджоре.Имя он получил по своему бывшему хозяину графу Джакомо Медолаго Альбани, купившему его для себя.Дворец был построен в конце 18 века с красивыми фигурами и колоннами, барельефами и лепниной, появившимися в середине 19 века.Сейчас здание в частной собственности, и в нем живут хозяева.Внутрь нас не пустили.
Wonderful place and new experience

Small but nice. Its quite nice considering the size of Bergamo. The ticket costs 3€, which includes admission to the natural science museum. All written signs are in italian but i think there are audio guides.
It is very old and the exposition has seen a better days, but as the entrance is free why not to come in...
Tiny, tiny museum. But together with museum of natural history (which is much bigger, and share the same 3 euro ticket) is ok.
Piccolo Museo incentrato sulla storia locale con diversi reperti delle varie epoche ritrovati nel territorio bergamasco, soprattutto romani.

Worth seeing place, excellent to visit with kids, interesting and reach exhibitions, many kinds of different species of animals displayed, but also prehistoric part with interesting fossils and reconstructions of dinos, geological part with different minerals and gems and ethnographic exhibition. My son was just amazed and not bored at all - there were several kids corners to draw but what was the most exciting to him - there were exhibits that he could touch or play with!
You just dont know how large the exibition is when you arrive at the front door. Very well elaborated, easy to move inside the building. I loved.
It was nice and interesting but no explanations in English
A wonderful museum, especially for kids. You get to see and touch all kinds of animals. A must see of you are at Bergamo!
So many dinosaurs! Fun place in old town Bergamo.

Little muzeul. Nice to visit. You can go up in the tower with the flag on top of it. Two things that were not ok: all the text was in Italian and there was no access in the near park ( with the cannons and the tank)
Not at all information in English, which make the visit pointless. But the view from the tower it's great

Start your adventures of this walled City from this Castle that offers expansive views of the city. Check out the museum for the extra five Euro's. All signature is in italian but Google translate does a great job.
Better than Milano. I Recomend to visit.
Locale gestito malissimo. Nessuna possibilità di visitare solo la zona panoramica senza pagare il biglietto, cosa gratuita fino a poco tempo fa. Delusissima, sconsigliato.

Appreciate it that it is a small city with this kind of high quality museum. However, would appreciate it further if the texts were more inspired and not just informational. Add a little background story details, or a humanistic curator's approach and you will inspire the public even more.
Fun little gallery. Modern and refreshing. You can get inside for free.

It is definitely worth a visit, let me get that out of the way. But compared with the beautifully curated and installed contemporary gallery opposite this is a bit of a mess. 

The works fight for space overly cramped walls, the restoration seems too aggressive to the point of inauthenticity. I am of the preservation rather than recreation school of restoration, so this may not be a problem for some. The truth is that the collection is great, and worth a look. 

But the chaotic reception areas, terrible typography on the walls and the odd silhouettes on the windows combine to give a 'designed by committee' vibe to the space.
10 euros for people under 25 years old. Clear instructions and nice officers. I especially like the logical 1,2,3,4.... conclusion of each room.
Amazing art museum with great Italian masterpieces.
Extraordinary altarpiece by Lotto in a beautiful architectural setting that includes a handful of interesting artworks.
Great market selling local produce
Good design
Chiesa del "sentieru`", centro del centro di Bergamo, appartenente all'ordine Domenicano. Bella da vedere fuori(facciata appena restaurata) splendida dentro con una tela del Lotto sopra l'altare.
ChiesA NEL. ENTRO DI BERGAMO..BELLA LA CHIESA ma il circostante magnifico
Super location and great place to eat. Menu and food is really good. Can deal with English speaking clients. Never had a bad meal here. Nice place to go for sure. A1

Very nice place to spend an evening with friends. Cosy interior and helpful Staff.

Very Good pizza especially one with speck, walnuts, arugula and gorgonzola. Equally good pasta.
This place was fantastic! Excellent food, amazing atmosphere. Incredible value for money. I can't recommend it enough!
Great food and service! Reasonable prices too.
Casoncelli al top
Great place to have dinner. try local dishes. good variety of wines. Friendly staff, fast service.

Great place, very tasty and the staff was super kind. They are even made my wife a spacial dish that didn't were on the menu just because she asked if they have this dish. Great expirience, very rexomended.
Good food but Staff is kind of rude
Really nice food. Great price and great service.
Good typical food from Bergamo, excellent service, very traditional location. Overall I would definitely recommend having lunch or dinner.
Great service and the food was excellent. Ordered a traditional food w/ polenta,rabbit, beef and sausage. Super. My family ordered pizza and was also great. We Recommend this restaurant 100%.

First night in Italy and stayed over the night before heading to Milan the next day. Walked past Is ciotola and looked nice and good prices. All our food was very nice and drinks were cheap €80 for 4.
Wonderful family run restaurant.  Great service.  The team created a special dish for us based on what we were craving at the moment.  Attentive and creative.
It was great, very good food, service is fast and the staff is very nice. Low prices considering that everything is included and there's no surprises on the bill

Great italian pizza. They have also very good beer (5 € for 40 cl). Prices are fair, pizza is really cheap (around 7 €). Fast and kind service, tip is included (coperto, 2 € per person). Many locals were there, that's always sign of quality.
